intro: Desmopsis brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Desmopsis brevipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
